decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the game by disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by utilizing powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Murktide Regent. The inclusion of counter spells such as Force of Will and Daze allows the deck to protect its key cards and maintain its aggressive stance throughout the match.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Mystic Forge, Voltaic Key, and Manifold Key to generate infinite mana and card advantage, allowing the player to cast and activate powerful artifacts such as Ugin, Eye of the Storms and The One Ring. The deck also includes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Mox Opal, as well as artifact tutors like Urza's Saga to assemble the combo pieces quickly. The inclusion of cards like Kozilek's Command and Paradoxical Outcome provides additional utility and ways to interact with the opponent. This deck aims to overpower the opponent with a fast and resilient combo strategy.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to cast Show and Tell in order to put Omniscience onto the battlefield. This allows the player to then cast big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn for free. The deck also includes cards like The One Ring and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to further enhance its combo potential. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells while bypassing traditional mana costs.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to control the board with counterspells and removal, while deploying efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. The deck makes use of cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also digging for more threats and answers with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, the deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands and land-based spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on using cards like Life from the Loam, Wasteland, and Ghost Quarter to deny the opponent resources and slow down their game plan. Additionally, the deck can create a powerful threat with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo. By controlling the board with lands and disruptive spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling and utilizing powerful combo pieces such as Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Stock Up and Atraxa, Grand Unifier help to set up the combo while also providing protection. The deck includes strong card selection and disruption in the form of Ponder, Brainstorm, and Force of Will. The mana base is designed to support the deck's high-cost spells with fetch lands and powerful dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with explosive plays and unbeatable threats.

The key concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to aggressively control the game through early threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting the opponent with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to apply pressure with creatures like Murktide Regent and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using card draw and manipulation like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain tempo and card advantage. Efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland are included to help clear the way for attacks and protect against opposing threats.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to dig for threats and maintain card advantage. With a mix of threats and disruption, this deck aims to control the early game while quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures and burn spells.

This Legacy combo deck aims to win the game by playing only non-land cards and utilizing cards such as Undercity Informer, Thassa's Oracle, and Balustrade Spy to quickly mill through the entire deck. By using a combination of cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual for mana acceleration, the deck is able to cast multiple spells in a single turn to reach its combo pieces. Protection is provided by Pact of Negation, while disruption is achieved through spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. The win condition is to either deck out the opponent or use Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed to execute a game-winning Doomsday combo. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana efficiently, while utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up the perfect sequence before casting Doomsday. The win condition revolves around using Doomsday to stack the library in a way that allows Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the same turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board state while maintaining pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By using a combination of hand disruption, removal, countermagic, and tempo plays, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and prevent the opponent from executing their plan effectively. The deck leverages the power of Dimir colors to provide a versatile and adaptable game plan that can adjust to various matchups and situations.

This deck revolves around using artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly assemble the Mystic Forge combo. By generating a large amount of mana through cards like Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith, the deck can cast powerful cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Karn, the Great Creator. Utilizing cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Manifold Key, this deck aims to utilize the Mystic Forge to cast multiple spells per turn, eventually overwhelming the opponent with sheer card advantage and powerful threats. The deck also includes interaction and disruption, such as Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern, to control the board and protect its combo pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost lands to ramp up mana quickly and play powerful spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The goal is to establish a large mana advantage using cards like The One Ring and Planar Nexus, while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The combo potential lies in combining powerful artifacts with spell control to overwhelm the opponent and control the game. The strategy involves quickly building up resources to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Griselbrand, using cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave. By using efficient mana ramp cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to cheat creatures into play early in the game for a quick win. This combo-reanimator strategy allows for explosive plays and the ability to overwhelm opponents with large threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board while quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. By including disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze, as well as versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to maintain tempo and outmaneuver opponents. With a good mix of card selection, removal, and threats, the deck aims to be proactive and aggressive in order to quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with combo pieces like Narcomoeba and Balustrade Spy, using cards like Dark Ritual and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate the process. Once the graveyard is full, the deck aims to win by casting Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to react.
